definition: ink stick/China ink/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/corporal punishment consisting of tattooing characters on the victim's forehead
surname Mo/abbr. for 墨西哥[Mo4 xi1 ge1], Mexico

sentences.english: He usually paints with Huizhou ink, which makes the paintings look very real.
sentences.chinese: 他通常使用徽墨來繪畫，這樣的畫十分逼真。

sentences.english: As a kind of typical traditional handicraft industries, Hui ink industry also had to be reconstructed.
sentences.chinese: 作爲典型的傳統手工業，徽墨業也不能例外。

definition: high-quality ink stonemade in Duanxi and Guangdong
fine writing paper, originally from Jing county 涇縣|泾县, Xuancheng 宣城, Anhui
Four Treasures of the Study, namely 筆|笔[bi3], 墨[mo4], 紙|纸[zhi3] and 硯|砚[yan4]/the essentials of calligraphy and scholarship (idiom)
Suzhou embroidery, one of the four major traditional styles of Chinese embroidery (the other three being 湘繡|湘绣[Xiang1 xiu4], 粵繡|粤绣[Yue4 xiu4] and 蜀繡|蜀绣[Shu3 xiu4])
fine paper made from bamboo, used for calligraphy, painting etc/also written 毛邊|毛边[mao2 bian1]
